section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: Developing software tools and systems to support fundamental rights. To make it easier for businesses to establish trust with customers by offering them clearly informed and fully flexible choice over data collected via the web.
relevant_communication:
Member of W3C Tracking protection Working Group (now Invited Expert status). 
Involved in many other Standards Development processes and Projects connected with the cause of extending User Control, Privacy and Data Protection. 
 
Baycloud Systems developed the first technical tool to enable compliance with the 2009 amended ePrivacy Directive, and introduced it to the market in 2011. 
CookieQ  allows companies with many websites, to offer their users clear and accurate information about first-party and third-party storage and content, in multiple languages and brand specific UX styles. Users can then give or revoke their consent at any time. 
When consent has not been given CookieQ actively manages the placement and use of first-party storage such as cookies, and blocks the downloading and rendering of third-party content that tracks without consent. 
Because we recognised early on that the management of third-party content was problematic for many companies, we became early member and active contributors to the W3C’s Do Not Track standardisation process.
